 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">9 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:14pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and Subsidiaries </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:14pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>Reconciliation of GAAP and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-GAAP</FONT> Financial Measures </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:14pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center"><B>(Unaudited) </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company reports its
financial results in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States (&#147;GAAP&#148;). However, management believes that also presenting certain <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures
provides additional information to facilitate comparison of the company&#146;s historical operating results and trends in its underlying operating results, and provides additional transparency on how the company evaluates its business. Management
uses these <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures in making financial, operating and planning decisions and in evaluating the company&#146;s performance. The company also believes that presenting these measures allows
investors to view its performance using the same measures that the company uses in evaluating its financial and business performance and trends. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The
company considers quantitative and qualitative factors in assessing whether to adjust for the impact of items that may be significant or that could affect an understanding of its ongoing financial and business performance or trends. The adjustments
generally fall within the following categories: acquisition&nbsp;&amp; divestiture activities, gains and losses on intangible asset sales and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-cash</FONT> impairments, major program restructuring activities,
constant currency and related adjustments, major program financing and hedging activities and other major items affecting comparability of operating results. See below for a description of adjustments to the company&#146;s U.S. GAAP financial
measures included herein. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-GAAP</FONT> information should be considered as supplemental in nature and is not meant to
be considered in isolation or as a substitute for the related financial information prepared in accordance with U.S. GAAP. In addition, the company&#146;s <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures may not be the same as or
comparable to similar <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> measures presented by other companies. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Because GAAP financial measures on a
forward-looking basis are not accessible and reconciling information is not available without unreasonable effort, the company has not provided that information with regard to the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures
in the company&#146;s outlook. Refer to the Outlook section below for more details. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">10 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>DEFINITIONS OF THE COMPANY&#146;S <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">NON-GAAP</FONT> FINANCIAL MEASURES </B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:6pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company&#146;s <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures and corresponding metrics reflect how the company evaluates its
operating results currently and provide improved comparability of operating results. As new events or circumstances arise, these definitions could change over time: </P> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;Organic Net Revenue&#148; is defined as net revenues excluding the impacts of acquisitions, divestitures <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(1)</SUP>; the historical global coffee business <SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(2)</SUP>; the historical Venezuelan operations; accounting calendar changes; and currency rate fluctuations. The company believes that Organic Net Revenue reflects the underlying growth from the ongoing
activities of its business and provides improved comparability of results. The company also evaluates Organic Net Revenue growth from emerging markets and its Power Brands. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;Adjusted Gross Profit&#148; is defined as gross profit excluding the 2012-2014 Restructuring Program; the 2014-2018 Restructuring Program <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(3)</SUP>; acquisition
integration costs; incremental costs associated with the Jacobs Douwe Egberts (&#147;JDE&#148;) coffee business transactions; the operating results of divestitures <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(1)</SUP>; the historical coffee
business operating results <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(2)</SUP>; the historical Venezuelan operating results; and <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts from
commodity and forecasted currency transaction derivative contracts <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(4)</SUP>. The company also presents &#147;Adjusted Gross Profit margin,&#148; which is subject to the same adjustments as Adjusted
Gross Profit. The company believes that Adjusted Gross Profit and Adjusted Gross Profit margin provide improved comparability of underlying operating results. The company also evaluates growth in the company&#146;s Adjusted Gross Profit on a
constant currency basis. </TD></TR></TABLE> <P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;Adjusted Operating Income&#148; and &#147;Adjusted Segment Operating Income&#148; are defined as operating income (or segment operating income) excluding the impacts of
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Spin-Off</FONT> Costs <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(5)</SUP>; the 2012-2014 Restructuring Program; the 2014-2018 Restructuring Program <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(3)</SUP>; the
Venezuela remeasurement and deconsolidation losses and historical operating results; gains or losses (including <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-cash</FONT> impairment charges) on goodwill and intangible assets; divestiture <SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(1)</SUP>&nbsp;or acquisition gains or losses and related integration and acquisition costs; the JDE coffee business transactions <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(2)</SUP><SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top"></SUP>&nbsp;gain and net incremental costs; the operating results of divestitures <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(1)</SUP>; the historical global coffee business operating results <SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(2)</SUP>; <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts from commodity and forecasted currency transaction derivative contracts <SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(4)</SUP>; and equity method investment earnings historically reported within operating income <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(6)</SUP>. The company also presents &#147;Adjusted Operating
Income margin&#148; and &#147;Adjusted Segment Operating Income margin&#148;, which are subject to the same adjustments as Adjusted Operating Income and Adjusted Segment Operating Income. The company believes that Adjusted Operating Income, Adjusted
Segment Operating Income, Adjusted Operating Income margin and Adjusted Segment Operating Income margin provide improved comparability of underlying operating results. The company also evaluates growth in the company&#146;s Adjusted Operating Income
and Adjusted Segment Operating Income on a constant currency basis. </TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">11 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;Adjusted EPS&#148; is defined as diluted EPS attributable to Mondel&#275;z International from continuing operations excluding the impacts of <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Spin-Off</FONT> Costs <SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(5)</SUP>; the 2012-2014 Restructuring Program; the 2014-2018 Restructuring Program <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(3)</SUP>; the Venezuela remeasurement and deconsolidation losses and
historical operating results; losses on debt extinguishment and related expenses; gains or losses (including <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-cash</FONT> impairment charges) on goodwill and intangible assets; divestiture <SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(1)</SUP>&nbsp;or acquisition gains or losses and related integration and acquisition costs; the JDE coffee business transactions <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(2)</SUP><SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top"></SUP>&nbsp;gain, transaction hedging gains or losses and net incremental costs; gain on the equity method investment exchange; net earnings from divestitures
<SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(1)</SUP>; <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts from commodity and forecasted currency transaction derivative contracts <SUP
STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(4)</SUP>; and gains or losses on interest rate swaps no longer designated as accounting cash flow hedges due to changed financing and hedging plans. Similarly, within Adjusted EPS, the company&#146;s equity
method investment net earnings exclude its proportionate share of its investees&#146; unusual or infrequent items <SUP STYLE="font-size:85%; vertical-align:top">(7)</SUP>, such as acquisition and divestiture-related costs and restructuring program
costs. The tax impact of each of the items excluded from the company&#146;s GAAP results was computed based on the facts and tax assumptions associated with each item and such impacts have also been excluded from Adjusted EPS. The company believes
that Adjusted EPS provides improved comparability of underlying operating results. The company also evaluates growth in the company&#146;s Adjusted EPS on a constant currency basis. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:6pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="2%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">&#149;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="1%" VALIGN="top">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">&#147;Free Cash Flow&#148; is defined as net cash provided by operating activities less capital expenditures. As Free Cash Flow is the company&#146;s primary measure used to monitor its cash flow performance, the
company believes this <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> measure provides investors additional useful information when evaluating its cash from operating activities. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(1)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Divestitures include completed sales of businesses and exits of major product lines upon completion of a sale or licensing agreement. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(2)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">In connection with the JDE coffee business transactions that closed on July&nbsp;2, 2015, because the company exchanged its coffee interests for <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">similarly-sized</FONT> coffee interests
in JDE at the time of the transaction, the company has deconsolidated and not included its historical global coffee business results within divestitures in its <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures. The company
continues to have an ongoing interest in the coffee business and as such, the company included the earnings of JDE, Keurig Green Mountain Inc. (&#147;Keurig&#148;) and its historical coffee business within continuing results of operations. Within
Adjusted EPS, the company included these earnings within equity method investment earnings and deconsolidated its historical coffee business results from Organic Net Revenue, Adjusted Gross Profit and Adjusted Operating Income to facilitate
comparisons of past and future coffee operating results. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(3)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-GAAP</FONT> adjustments related to the 2014-2018 Restructuring Program reflect costs incurred that relate to the objectives of the company&#146;s program to transform its supply
chain network and organizational structure. Costs that do not meet the program objectives are not reflected in the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> adjustments. </TD></TR></TABLE>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">12 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">


<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(4)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">During the third quarter of 2016, the company began to exclude unrealized gains and losses <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">(mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts) from outstanding
commodity and forecasted currency transaction derivatives from its <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> earnings measures until such time that the related exposures impact its operating results. Since the company purchases commodity and
forecasted currency contracts to mitigate price volatility primarily for inventory requirements in future periods, the company made this adjustment to remove the volatility of these future inventory purchases on current operating results to
facilitate comparisons of its underlying operating performance across periods. The company also discontinued designating commodity and forecasted currency transaction derivatives for hedge accounting treatment. To facilitate comparisons of the
company&#146;s underlying operating results, the company has recast all historical <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> earnings measures to exclude the
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(5)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Refer to Note 2, <I>Divestitures and Acquisitions &#150; <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Spin-Off</FONT> of Kraft Foods Group</I>, to the consolidated financial statements in the company&#146;s Form <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">10-K</FONT> for the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 for more information on <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Spin-Off</FONT> Costs incurred in connection with the October&nbsp;1, 2012
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">spin-off</FONT> of the Kraft Foods Group grocery business. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(6)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">Historically, the company has recorded income from equity method investments within its operating income as these investments operated as extensions of the company&#146;s base business. Beginning in the third quarter of
2015, the company began to record the earnings from its equity method investments in <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax</FONT> equity method investment earnings outside of operating income following the deconsolidation of its coffee
business. In periods prior to July&nbsp;2, 2015, the company has reclassified the equity method earnings from Adjusted Operating Income to <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax</FONT> equity method investment earnings within Adjusted EPS to be
consistent with the deconsolidation of its coffee business results on July&nbsp;2, 2015 and in order to evaluate its operating results on a consistent basis. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<TABLE STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:8pt" BORDER="0" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" WIDTH="100%">
<TR style = "page-break-inside:avoid">
<TD WIDTH="5%">&nbsp;</TD>
<TD WIDTH="3%" VALIGN="top" ALIGN="left">(7)</TD>
<TD ALIGN="left" VALIGN="top">The company has excluded its proportionate share of its equity method investees&#146; unusual or infrequent items in order to provide investors with a comparable view of its performance across periods. Although the
company has shareholder rights and board representation commensurate with its ownership interests in its equity method investees and reviews the underlying operating results and unusual or infrequent items with them each reporting period, the
company does not have direct control over the operations or resulting revenue and expenses. The company&#146;s use of equity method investment net earnings on an adjusted basis is not intended to imply that the company has any such control. The
company&#146;s GAAP &#147;diluted EPS attributable to Mondelez International from continuing operations&#148; includes all of its investees&#146; unusual and infrequent items. </TD></TR></TABLE>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">See the attached schedules for supplemental financial data and corresponding reconciliations of the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial
measures referred to above to the most comparable GAAP financial measures for the three months and year ended December 31, 2016 and 2015. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>SEGMENT
OPERATING INCOME </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company uses segment operating income to evaluate segment performance and allocate resources. The company believes it is
appropriate to disclose this measure to help investors analyze segment performance and trends. Segment operating income excludes unrealized gains and losses on hedging activities (which are a component of cost of sales), general corporate expenses
(which are a component of selling, general and administrative expenses), amortization of intangibles, gains and losses on divestitures or acquisitions, gain on the JDE coffee business transactions, loss on the deconsolidation of Venezuela and
acquisition-related costs (which are a component of selling, general and administrative expenses) in all periods presented. The company excludes these items from segment operating income </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">13 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
in order to provide better transparency of its segment operating results. Furthermore, the company centrally manages interest and other expense, net. Accordingly, the company does not present
these items by segment because they are excluded from the segment profitability measure that management reviews. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>ITEMS IMPACTING COMPARABILITY OF
OPERATING RESULTS </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The following information is provided to give qualitative and quantitative information related to items impacting comparability of
operating results. The company determines which items to consider as &#147;items impacting comparability&#148; based on how management views the company&#146;s business; makes financial, operating and planning decisions; and evaluates the
company&#146;s ongoing performance. In addition, the company discloses the impact of changes in currency exchange rates on the company&#146;s financial results in order to reflect results on a constant currency basis. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Divestitures </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On December&nbsp;1, 2016, the
company completed the sale of a confectionery business in Costa Rica represented by a local brand. The sales price was $28&nbsp;million and the company recorded a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> gain of $9&nbsp;million in the three
months ended December&nbsp;31, 2016. In connection with this transaction, the company incurred $2&nbsp;million of transaction costs and accrued expenses. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On April&nbsp;23, 2015, the company completed the divestiture of its 50&nbsp;percent equity interest in a Japanese coffee joint venture, to its joint venture
partner, which generated cash proceeds of 27&nbsp;billion Japanese yen ($225&nbsp;million as of April&nbsp;23, 2015) and a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> gain of $13&nbsp;million <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">(after-tax</FONT>
loss of $9 million) in the three months ended June&nbsp;30, 2015. The company contributed to JDE the net cash proceeds from the sale of the interest. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Divestiture-related costs </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On March&nbsp;31, 2016,
the company received a binding offer for the sale of several manufacturing facilities in France and sale or license of several local confectionery brands. The transactions are subject to E.U. and local regulatory approvals, completion of employee
consultation requirements and additional steps to prepare the assets for transfer. During the fourth quarter, the company received the Works Council approval and the buyer obtained antitrust clearance in all markets where it was required.
Additionally, the company incurred and accrued $2&nbsp;million in the three months and $86&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, of incremental expenses to ready the business for the sale transactions expected to close in 2017. The
company recorded these costs within cost of sales and selling, general and administrative expenses of its Europe segment. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">14 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Acquisitions and acquisition-related costs </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On November&nbsp;2, 2016, the company purchased from Burton&#146;s Biscuit Company certain intangibles which include the license to manufacture, market and
sell Cadbury-branded biscuits in additional key markets around the world, including in the U.K., France, Ireland, North America and Saudi Arabia. The purchase added incremental net revenues of $16&nbsp;million (constant currency basis) in the three
months ended December&nbsp;31, 2016. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On July&nbsp;15, 2015, the company acquired a controlling interest in a biscuit operation in Vietnam within its AMEA
segment and on August&nbsp;22, 2016, the company acquired the remaining interest. The acquisition added incremental net revenues of $71&nbsp;million (constant currency basis) in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On February&nbsp;16, 2015, the company also acquired a U.S. snack food company (Enjoy Life Foods) within its North America segment. The acquisition added
incremental net revenues of $5&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company recorded acquisition-related costs of $1&nbsp;million
in the three months and year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and $8&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. These acquisition-related costs were recorded in selling, general and administrative expenses. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Acquisition integration costs </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Within the
company&#146;s AMEA segment, in connection with the acquisition of a biscuit operation in Vietnam, the company recorded integration costs of $1&nbsp;million in the three months and $7&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and
$4&nbsp;million in the three months and $9&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The company recorded these acquisition integration costs in selling, general and administrative expenses. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Accounting calendar change </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">In connection with
moving toward a common consolidation date across the company, in the first quarter of 2015, the company changed the consolidation date for its North America segment from the last Saturday of each period to the last calendar day of each period. The
change had a favorable impact on net revenues of $19&nbsp;million in the three months and $76&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. As a result of this change, each of the company&#146;s operating subsidiaries now reports results as
of the last calendar day of the period. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>2012-2014 Restructuring Program </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On October&nbsp;1, 2012, the company completed the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Spin-Off</FONT> of its North American grocery business, Kraft Foods Group,
to its shareholders. Prior to this transaction, in 2012, the company&#146;s Board of Directors approved $1.5&nbsp;billion of restructuring and related implementation costs (&#147;2012-2014 Restructuring
</P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">15 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
Program&#148;) reflecting primarily severance, asset disposals and other manufacturing-related <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">one-time</FONT> costs. The primary objective of the restructuring
and implementation activities was to ensure that Mondel&#275;z International and Kraft Foods Group were each set up to operate efficiently and execute on their respective business strategies upon separation and in the future. Of the
$1.5&nbsp;billion of 2012-2014 Restructuring Program costs, the company retained approximately $925&nbsp;million and Kraft Foods Group retained the balance of the program. Through the end of 2014, the company incurred total restructuring and related
implementation charges of $899&nbsp;million and completed incurring planned charges on the 2012-2014 Restructuring Program. The company recorded reversals to the restructuring charges of $1&nbsp;million in the three months and $4&nbsp;million in the
year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 related to accruals no longer required. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>2014-2018 Restructuring Program </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On May&nbsp;6, 2014, the company&#146;s Board of Directors approved a $3.5&nbsp;billion restructuring program, comprised of approximately $2.5&nbsp;billion in
cash costs and $1&nbsp;billion in <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-cash</FONT> costs (&#147;2014-2018 Restructuring Program&#148;), and up to $2.2&nbsp;billion of capital expenditures. On August&nbsp;31, 2016, the company&#146;s Board of
Directors approved a reallocation within the program of $600&nbsp;million of previously approved capital expenditures to be spent on restructuring program cash costs, resulting in $3.1&nbsp;billion of cash costs to be expensed and up to
$1.6&nbsp;billion of capital expenditures. There was no change to the total $5.7&nbsp;billion of total program costs and no change to the total $4.7&nbsp;billion of cash outlays. The primary objective of the 2014-2018 Restructuring Program is to
reduce the company&#146;s operating cost structure in both supply chain and overhead costs. The program is intended primarily to cover severance as well as asset disposals and other manufacturing-related
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">one-time</FONT> costs. Since inception, the company has incurred total restructuring and related implementation charges of $2.5&nbsp;billion related to the 2014-2018 Restructuring Program. The company has incurred
the majority of the program&#146;s charges through 2016 and expects to complete the program by <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">year-end</FONT> 2018. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>Restructuring costs </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company recorded restructuring
charges of $234&nbsp;million in the three months and $714&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and $269&nbsp;million in the three months and $711&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 within asset impairment and exit
costs. These charges were for asset write-downs (including accelerated depreciation and asset impairments), severance and other related costs. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>Implementation costs </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Implementation costs are directly
attributable to restructuring activities; however, they do not qualify for special accounting treatment as exit or disposal activities. Implementation costs primarily relate to reorganizing the company&#146;s operations and facilities in connection
with its supply chain reinvention program and other identified productivity and cost saving initiatives. The costs include incremental expenses related to the closure of facilities, costs to terminate certain contracts and the simplification of the
company&#146;s information systems. The company recorded implementation costs of $86&nbsp;million in the </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">16 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
three months and $372&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016 and $106&nbsp;million in the three months and $291&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. The company
recorded these costs within cost of sales and general corporate expense within selling, general and administrative expenses. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Venezuela
remeasurement and deconsolidation losses </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Effective as of the close of the 2015 fiscal year, the company concluded that it no longer met the
accounting criteria for consolidation of its Venezuelan subsidiaries due to a loss of control over its Venezuelan operations and an other-than-temporary lack of currency exchangeability. As of the close of the 2015 fiscal year, the company
deconsolidated and changed to the cost method of accounting for its Venezuelan operations. The company recorded a $778&nbsp;million <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> loss on December&nbsp;31, 2015 as it reduced the value of its cost
method investment in Venezuela and all Venezuelan receivables held by its other subsidiaries to realizable fair value, resulting in full impairment. The recorded loss also included historical cumulative translation adjustments related to the
company&#146;s Venezuelan operations that the company had previously recorded in accumulated other comprehensive losses within equity. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Beginning in 2016,
the company no longer includes net revenues, earnings or net assets of its Venezuelan subsidiaries within its consolidated financial statements. Under the cost method of accounting, earnings are only recognized to the extent cash is received. Given
the current and ongoing difficult economic, regulatory and business environment in Venezuela, there continues to be significant uncertainty related to the company&#146;s operations in Venezuela, and the company expects these conditions will continue
for the foreseeable future. The company will monitor the extent of its ability to control its Venezuelan operations and the liquidity and availability of U.S. dollars at different rates, as the company&#146;s current situation in Venezuela may
change over time and lead to consolidation at a future date. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company recorded no revenues, earnings or other financial results from its Venezuelan
subsidiaries during the three months and year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016. For the three months and the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015, the operating results of its Venezuelan operations were included in the company&#146;s condensed consolidated
statements of earnings. During the first quarter of 2015, the company recognized an $11&nbsp;million currency-related remeasurement loss resulting from a devaluation of the Venezuela bolivar exchange rates the company historically used to source
U.S. dollars for purchases of imported raw materials, packaging and other goods and services. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">17 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Removal of historical Venezuela net revenues, operating income and net earnings </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company removed its historical operating results for its Venezuelan subsidiaries from its historical Organic Net Revenue, Adjusted Gross Profit, Adjusted
Operating Income and Adjusted EPS to facilitate comparisons of past and future operating results and net earnings. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>JDE coffee business transactions
</I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On July&nbsp;2, 2015, the company completed transactions to combine the company&#146;s wholly owned coffee businesses with those of D.E Master
Blenders 1753 B.V. (&#147;DEMB&#148;) to create a new company, JDE. Following the exchange of a portion of the company&#146;s investment in JDE for an interest in Keurig in March 2016, the company held a 26.5% equity interest in JDE. The remaining
73.5% interest in JDE was held by a subsidiary of Acorn Holdings B.V. (&#147;AHBV&#148;, owner of DEMB prior to July&nbsp;2, 2015). Following transactions related to JDE stock-based compensation arrangements tied to the issuance of JDE equity
compensation awards to JDE employees, as of December&nbsp;31, 2016, the company held a 26.4% equity interest in JDE. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">In connection with the contribution
of the company&#146;s global coffee business to JDE on July&nbsp;2, 2015, the company recorded a final <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> gain of $6.8&nbsp;billion (or $6.6&nbsp;billion after taxes) in the second half of 2015 after
final adjustments were reflected as described below. The company also recorded approximately $1.0&nbsp;billion of net gains related to hedging the expected cash proceeds from the transaction as described further below. During the fourth quarter of
2015, the company and JDE concluded negotiations of a sales price adjustment and completed the valuation of the company&#146;s investment in JDE. Primarily due to the negotiated resolution of the sales price adjustment in the fourth quarter, the
company recorded a $313&nbsp;million reduction in the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> gain on the coffee transaction, reducing the $7.1&nbsp;billion estimated gain in the third quarter to the $6.8&nbsp;billion final gain for 2015. As
part of the company&#146;s sales price negotiations, the company retained the right to collect future cash payments if certain estimated pension liabilities are realized over an agreed amount in the future. As such, the company may recognize
additional income related to this negotiated term in the future. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">In 2014 and 2015, in connection with the expected receipt of cash in euros at the time
of closing, the company entered into a number of consecutive currency exchange forward contracts to lock in an equivalent expected value in U.S. dollars as of the date the coffee business transactions were first announced in May 2014. Cumulatively,
the company realized aggregate net gains and received cash of approximately $1.0&nbsp;billion on these hedging contracts that increased the cash the company received in connection with the JDE coffee business transactions from $4.2&nbsp;billion in
cash consideration received to $5.2&nbsp;billion. In connection with these currency contracts, the company recognized net gains of $436&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015 within interest and other expense, net. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">18 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company also incurred incremental expenses related to readying its global coffee businesses for the
transactions that totaled $39&nbsp;million in the three months and $278&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. Of these total expenses, $123&nbsp;million was recorded within asset impairment and exit costs in 2015 and the remainder
was recorded within selling, general and administrative expenses of primarily the company&#146;s Europe segment as well as within general corporate expenses. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Gain on equity method investment exchange </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On
March&nbsp;3, 2016, a subsidiary of AHBV completed the $13.9&nbsp;billion acquisition of all of the outstanding common stock of Keurig through a merger transaction. On March&nbsp;7, 2016, the company exchanged with a subsidiary of AHBV a portion of
the company&#146;s equity interest in JDE with a carrying value of &#128;1.7&nbsp;billion (approximately $2.0&nbsp;billion as of March&nbsp;7, 2016) for an interest in Keurig with a fair value of $2.0&nbsp;billion based on the merger consideration
per share for Keurig. The company recorded the difference between the fair value of Keurig and its basis in JDE shares as a $43&nbsp;million gain on the equity method investment exchange in March 2016. Immediately following the exchange, the
company&#146;s ownership interest in JDE was 26.5% and its interest in Keurig was 24.2%. The company accounts for its investments in JDE and Keurig under the equity method and recognizes its share of their earnings within equity method investment
earnings and its share of their dividends within the company&#146;s cash flows. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Reclassification of historical coffee business net revenues,
operating income and net earnings </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company removed its historical coffee business operating results from its historical Organic Net Revenue,
Adjusted Gross Profit and Adjusted Operating Income and reclassified historical coffee business <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax</FONT> earnings to equity method investment net earnings in Adjusted EPS to facilitate comparisons of past and
future operating results and net earnings. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Reclassification of equity method investment earnings </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Historically, the company recorded income from equity method investments within operating income as these investments operated as extensions of its base
business. Beginning in the third quarter of 2015, to align with the accounting for JDE earnings, the company began to record the earnings from equity method investments in equity method investment net earnings outside of segment operating income. To
facilitate comparisons of its underlying operating results, for periods prior to July&nbsp;2, 2015, the company has recast all historical <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> earnings measures to reclassify earnings from equity method
investments historically recorded within segment operating income to equity method investment net earnings. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">19 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Equity method investee adjustments </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Within Adjusted EPS, the company&#146;s equity method investment net earnings exclude its proportionate share of its investees&#146; unusual or infrequent
items, such as acquisition and divestiture-related costs and restructuring program costs. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts from commodity and currency derivative contracts </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">During the third quarter of 2016,
the company began to exclude unrealized gains and losses <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">(mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts) from outstanding commodity and forecasted currency transaction derivatives from its <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> earnings measures until such time that the related exposures impact its operating results. To facilitate comparisons of its underlying operating results, the company has recast all historical <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> earnings measures to exclude the <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company recorded net unrealized losses on commodity and forecasted currency transaction derivatives of $45&nbsp;million in the three months and
$94&nbsp;million in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016. The company recorded net unrealized gains on commodity and forecasted currency transaction derivatives of $21&nbsp;million in the three months and $56&nbsp;million ($96&nbsp;million
including coffee-related activity) in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2015. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Loss on debt extinguishment and related costs </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On December&nbsp;16, 2016, the company redeemed $850&nbsp;million of 2.250% fixed rate notes, maturing on February&nbsp;1, 2019, that were issued on
January&nbsp;16, 2014. The company recorded, within interest and other expense, net, a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> loss on debt extinguishment of $18&nbsp;million in connection with this redemption in the three months ended
December&nbsp;31, 2016. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On October&nbsp;31, 2016, the company completed a cash tender offer and retired $3.18&nbsp;billion of its outstanding high coupon
long-term debt. The company recorded, within interest and other expense, net, a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> loss on debt extinguishment and related expenses of $409&nbsp;million in the three months ended December&nbsp;31, 2016,
for the amount paid in excess of the carrying value of the debt and from recognizing in earnings the related unamortized discounts and deferred financing costs. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On November&nbsp;30, 2015, the company completed a cash tender offer and retired &pound;247&nbsp;million (approximately $372 million) of its outstanding high
coupon long-term debt. The company recorded, within interest and other expense, net, a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> loss on debt extinguishment and related expenses of $40&nbsp;million in the three months ended December&nbsp;31,
2015, for the amount paid in excess of the carrying value of the debt and from recognizing unamortized premiums and deferred financing costs. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On
March&nbsp;20, 2015, the company completed a cash tender offer and retired $2.5&nbsp;billion of its outstanding high coupon long-term debt. The company recorded, within interest and other expense, </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">20 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
net, a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> loss on debt extinguishment and related expenses of $708&nbsp;million in the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2015, for the amount paid in
excess of the carrying value of the debt and from recognizing in earnings the related unamortized discounts and deferred financing costs. The company also recognized $5&nbsp;million of charges within interest expense from hedging instruments related
to the retired debt. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Loss related to interest rate swaps </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company recognized <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> losses of $97&nbsp;million in the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2016, and
$34&nbsp;million in the three months ended March&nbsp;31, 2015, within interest and other expense, net related to certain U.S. dollar interest rate swaps that the company no longer designated as accounting cash flow hedges due to a change in
financing plans. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Intangible assets gains and losses </I></B></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>Impairment charges </I></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On March&nbsp;31, 2016, in connection
with the planned sale of a confectionery business in France, the company recorded a $14&nbsp;million impairment charge for a gum&nbsp;&amp; candy trademark as a portion of its carrying value would not be recoverable based on future cash flows
expected under a planned license agreement with the buyer. In May 2016, the company recorded an additional $5&nbsp;million impairment charge for another candy trademark to reduce the overall net assets to the estimated net sales proceeds after
transaction costs. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">In the three months ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, during the company&#146;s annual testing of
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-amortizable</FONT> intangible assets, the company recorded $98&nbsp;million of impairment charges related to five trademarks. These charges related to biscuits, candy and gum trademarks of $41&nbsp;million in
AMEA, $32&nbsp;million in North America, $22&nbsp;million in Europe, and $2&nbsp;million in Latin America. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">In addition, during the three months ended
December&nbsp;31, 2016, the company recorded impairment charges of $4&nbsp;million in AMEA and $4&nbsp;million in Europe related to biscuits trademarks. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">During the three months ended September&nbsp;30, 2016, the company discontinued one biscuit product that resulted in a $4&nbsp;million intangible asset
impairment charge in AMEA. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On June&nbsp;30, 2016, in connection with the company&#146;s global supply chain reinvention initiatives, the company made a
determination to discontinue manufacturing a candy product that resulted in a $7&nbsp;million impairment charge in North America. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">In 2015, the company
recorded a $44&nbsp;million charge related to candy and biscuit trademarks in AMEA, $22&nbsp;million in Europe and $5&nbsp;million in Latin America. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">21 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><I>Gain on sales of intangible assets </I></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On May&nbsp;2, 2016, the company completed the sale of certain local biscuit brands in Finland as part of the company&#146;s strategic decisions to exit select
small and local brands and shift investment towards its Power Brands. Upon closing, the company divested $8&nbsp;million of indefinite-lived intangible assets and less than $1&nbsp;million of other assets. After transaction costs, the company
recorded a <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> gain of $6&nbsp;million ($5&nbsp;million <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax)</FONT> in the three months ended June&nbsp;30, 2016 within selling, general and administrative expenses
of its Europe segment. In the three months ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, the company received another $2&nbsp;million of consideration following the completion of post-closing requirements, resulting in a total
<FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">pre-tax</FONT> gain of $8&nbsp;million ($6&nbsp;million <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">after-tax)</FONT> in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016, recorded within selling, general and administrative expenses of its
Europe segment. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">On August&nbsp;26, 2016, the company recorded a $7&nbsp;million gain for the sale of a U.S.-owned biscuit trademark. The gain was
recorded within selling, general and administrative expenses of its North America segment in the year ended December&nbsp;31, 2016. </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B><I>Constant
currency </I></B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">Management evaluates the operating performance of the company and its international subsidiaries on a constant currency basis. The
company determines its constant currency operating results by dividing or multiplying, as appropriate, the current period local currency operating results by the currency exchange rates used to translate the company&#146;s financial statements in
the comparable prior-year period to determine what the current period U.S. dollar operating results would have been if the currency exchange rate had not changed from the comparable prior-year period. </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:18pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman"><B>OUTLOOK </B></P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">The company&#146;s outlooks for 2017 Organic Net
Revenue growth, 2017 and 2018 Adjusted Operating Income margin and 2017 Adjusted EPS growth on a constant currency basis are <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">non-GAAP</FONT> financial measures that exclude or otherwise adjust for items impacting
comparability of financial results such as the impact of changes in foreign currency exchange rates, restructuring activities, acquisitions and divestitures. The company is not able to reconcile its full year 2017 projected Organic Net Revenue
growth to its full year 2017 projected reported net revenue growth because the company is unable to predict the 2017 impact of foreign exchange due to the unpredictability of future changes in foreign exchange rates, which could be material as a
significant portion of the company&#146;s operations are outside the U.S. The company is not able to reconcile its full year 2017 and 2018 projected Adjusted Operating Income margin to its full year 2017 and 2018 projected reported operating income
margin because the company is unable to predict the timing of its Restructuring Program costs, <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts from commodity and forecasted currency transaction
derivative contracts and impacts from potential acquisitions or divestitures. The company is not able to reconcile its full year 2017 projected Adjusted </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">22 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman">
EPS growth on a constant currency basis to its full year 2017 projected reported diluted EPS growth because the company is unable to predict the timing of its Restructuring Program costs, <FONT
STYLE="white-space:nowrap"><FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">mark-to-market</FONT></FONT> impacts from commodity and forecasted currency forecasted derivative contracts, impacts from potential acquisitions or divestitures as well as the impact of
foreign exchange due to the unpredictability of future changes in foreign exchange rates, which could be material as a significant portion of the company&#146;s operations are outside the U.S. Therefore, because of the uncertainty and variability of
the nature and amount of future adjustments, which could be significant, the company is unable to provide a reconciliation of these measures without unreasonable effort. </P>
 <p STYLE="margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt ; font-size:8pt">&nbsp;</P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">23 </P>


<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right"><U>Schedule 4a </U></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and Subsidiaries </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">Reconciliation of GAAP to <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-GAAP</FONT> Measures </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">Net Revenues </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">(in millions of U.S.
dollars) (Unaudited) </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>

<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

<p Style='page-break-before:always'>
<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">

 <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="right"><U>Schedule 8a </U></P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:12pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">Mondel&#275;z International, Inc. and Subsidiaries </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">Reconciliation of GAAP to <FONT STYLE="white-space:nowrap">Non-GAAP</FONT> Measures </P>
<P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">Segment Data </P> <P STYLE="margin-top:0pt; margin-bottom:0pt; font-size:10pt; font-family:Times New Roman" ALIGN="center">(in millions of U.S.
dollars) (Unaudited) </P> <P STYLE="font-size:12pt;margin-top:0pt;margin-bottom:0pt">&nbsp;</P>
<TABLE CELLSPACING="0" CELLPADDING="0" WIDTH="100%" BORDER="0" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE; font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt" ALIGN="center">

<HR  SIZE="3" style="COLOR:#999999" WIDTH="100%" ALIGN="CENTER">
